summary: This is an internal FBI Office of Public Affairs email regarding media inquiries about Prince Andrew's connection to Jeffrey Epstein. It notes that the Daily Mail requested comment on a Reuters article stating investigators wanted to interview Prince Andrew as a potential co-conspirator or witness, and that the FBI declined to comment.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Person of interest / potential co-conspirator or witness
persons.context: Subject of a Reuters article stating investigators want to interview him about his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein. The article labels him a person of interest as a co-conspirator or witness for the USAOâ€”Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier whose friendship with Prince Andrew is the subject of the media inquiry and investigation.

connections.description: Described in the document as a 'friendship' that is the subject of a criminal investigation.

events.title: FBI OPA Media Inquiry on Prince Andrew
events.description: The FBI Office of Public Affairs receives and handles a media inquiry from the Daily Mail regarding a Reuters article about investigators wanting to interview Prince Andrew concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A Reuters article stated investigators wanted to interview Prince Andrew about his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein.
The article characterized Prince Andrew as a 'person of interest as a co-conspirator' to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, or at minimum a witness.
The FBI Office of Public Affairs, in coordination with FBI New York, declined to comment on the media inquiry.
